heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 23 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (181°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 1.7°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 4.6°C), feels like temperature (up 5.8°C), cloud levels (up 391 m), and outside temperature (up 5.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 26.9m lower than yesterday, 46.5m lower than the past week, 391.0m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 791m to 1764m and averaged 1018.9m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and very little to no wind will be present. Showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and periods of sunshine are expected. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
